text: Is there any reason an <Icon>  might not work inside an Island?
Hello, can you provide me your portalId in a DM?
thanks for this data fetching explanation <@UAYBXDG4U> <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N0arXQOyfXo>. This will definitely be useful

Hello community! I'm new here, for some context: I'm struggling to set up a new react based cms for my company based on dynamic components that can insert into DnD templates and edit the content of them from the HS edit pages.
I'm doing some tests and I'm encountering problems to make some libraries like swiper or react-slick work, but I'm not able to make them work, I guess it has something to do with the environment is a SSR, is this correct? is there any way to make this kind of libraries work?
Best regards and thanks for your time!

Could be when the Island has another layer of initial hidden content where the Icon component is used in. Not only the Icon comp will stop working but every HS Component will stop working.

If itâ€™s just inside an (Island) element which is visible during page load, then it should work. Just remember to 10 times double check the fieldPath haha.
Hey <@U07FKRKDUMB>, excited to have you in the community! Could you share specifics on the problems you are encountering?

For example, in these libraries the buttons to make the movement do not work.
Now for example I'm trying to use `Material-UI` and I get a more precise error:
```[vite] Error when evaluating SSR module {path}/lp-project/lp-app/components/modules/000-lp-kit-react-base/index: failed to import "/node_modules/@mui/icons-material/ExpandMore.js"
|- ReferenceError: exports is not defined
    at eval ({path}/lp-project/lp-app/node_modules/@mui/icons-material/utils/createSvgIcon.js:8:23)
    at async instantiateModule ({path}/lp-project/lp-app/node_modules/vite/dist/node/chunks/dep-41cf5ffd.js:56052:9)```

In other cases I have tried using useEffect and it doesn't work either, it is something that has happened to me in other projects and it is related to the SSR issue but here I don't know how to avoid this
